document_data.mainbody:
Kuang Ming Ling was a shukenja-in-training in Shou Lung around 1357 DR.
Kuang Ming was the daughter of a wealthy merchant from Linshung who, against her fathers wishes, decided to train as a shukenja. Around 1357 DR, she decided to go on pilgrimage to a far-away monastery. Her father sent with her two korobokuru retainers to protect the girl. 
Kuang Ming was a romantic but headstrong woman.
Kuang Ming traveled with two korobokuru retainers of her father Hsiao Nan Tzu Wen and Ling Yu Pao.
